page.title: 02HOUSING IN DEWSBURY MOOR
page.content: The area under study was two small estates in Dewsbury Moor. The houses in the{"Becket"}and{"Pilgrim"}estates are council houses, built in 1928/29. Originally,{Pilgrim Farm}occupied the land but it was pulled down to make way for the new estate which retained the name pilgrim. Only 10 of the houses on the Becket estate and 2 in the Pilgrim estate are privately owned despite{government {policy}to encourage purchase of council houses since 1979. There are a variety of different types of housing on the estates including terraces, bungalows and semi-detached - all of which are brick built. The people living on the two estates are a mixture of{English}and{Asian families. Strangely enough some modern Georgian-designed detached houses have been built next to the estates.
